key_points: Heavy rain and wind from the remnants of Hurricane Ida caused disruptions at the U.S. Open, including downed tree limbs and flooding.
A match between Diego Schwartzman and Kevin Anderson was delayed for 2 1/2 hours and moved from Louis Armstrong Stadium to Arthur Ashe Stadium due to rain infiltration.
The National Weather Service in New York issued its first-ever set of flash flood emergencies for the region.
Subway stations and tracks were flooded, leading to the suspension of all service, and a travel ban was put in place for all non-emergency vehicles until 5 a.m. ET Thursday.
Louis Armstrong Stadium's naturally ventilated roof allowed rain to blow onto the court, disrupting play.
A scheduled match between Angelique Kerber and Anhelina Kalinina was postponed to Thursday due to the weather.
Diego Schwartzman expressed a strong desire to finish his match on the same day instead of postponing.
Stefanos Tsitsipas's match against Adrian Mannarino was also delayed, prolonging the wait for Schwartzman vs. Anderson to resume.
Tsitsipas took an eight-minute toilet break, leading to boos from spectators upon his return.
Flash flood emergency warnings were issued for New York and New Jersey as the remnants of Tropical Storm Ida moved through the Northeast.
